Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Packages without titles should have title: search their ID" (#7378) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

This can easily be done by subbing the ID into the empty title field.

Example:
https://azuresearch-usnc.nuget.org/query?q=owners:aspnet-contrib%20title:OAuth

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Disable MSBuild Node Reuse temporarily so Linux doesn't timeout" (#8381) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
[DDNuGet-Linux ](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_settings/agentqueues?_a=agents&queueId=811&view=agents) build machines have been failing to complete due to timeout: `The job running on agent DDNuGetL001 has exceeded the maximum execution time of 60. `

The MSBuild team suggested this is a known problem which can be avoided at the cost of:
1. it's deliberately undoing a performance optimization
2. it takes you (very slightly) out of normal codepaths

Setting the Environment Variable avoids the problem: `MSBUILDDISABLENODEREUSE=1 `

MSBuild tracking issue: https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/11560
NuGet tracking issue:

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Undo temporary workaround for MSBuild bug causing Linux to timeout" (#8382) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
In [this issue](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8381), we set an Environment Variable to avoid a timeout caused by MSBuild: `MSBUILDDISABLENODEREUSE=1`.

Once MSBuild resolves [this issue](https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/11560), we should stop using this Environment Variable.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Disable MSBuild Node Reuse temporarily so Linux doesn't timeout" (#8381) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
[DDNuGet-Linux ](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_settings/agentqueues?_a=agents&queueId=811&view=agents) build machines have been failing to complete due to timeout: `The job running on agent DDNuGetL001 has exceeded the maximum execution time of 60. `

The MSBuild team suggested this is a known problem which can be avoided at the cost of:
1. it's deliberately undoing a performance optimization
2. it takes you (very slightly) out of normal codepaths

Setting the Environment Variable avoids the problem: `MSBUILDDISABLENODEREUSE=1 `

MSBuild tracking issue: https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/11560
NuGet tracking issue:

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Documentation:  NuGet API documentation does not describe possible exceptions" (#8380) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/visual-studio-extensibility/nuget-api-in-visual-studio.

XML doc comments for each interface member should describe which exceptions may be thrown and why via the [`<exception />`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/xmldoc/exception) tag.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Regression in 'Nuget sources add' causes "The ':' character, hexadecimal value 0x3A, cannot be included in a name" errors" (#7948) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: nuget.exe

NuGet version: 4.9.4.5839

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 4.6.0.4653

## Automated Repro

1. Unzip [nugetColonRepro.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3034964/nugetColonRepro.zip) somewhere on your machine
2. Run repro.bat


## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Run `nuget sources add -name http://foo.com -Source http://foo.com -config %workdir%\nuget.config`
   - This succeeds
2. Run `nuget sources add -name http://foo.com -Source http://foo.com -config %workdir%\nuget.config -username user -password password`
   - This fails with the error `The ':' character, hexadecimal value 0x3A, cannot be included in a name.`
   - This used to work fine in 4.6.0

## Verbose Logs

Setting `-verbosity detailed` yields this stack trace:

> The ':' character, hexadecimal value 0x3A, cannot be included in a name.
> System.Xml.XmlException: The ':' character, hexadecimal value 0x3A, cannot be included in a name.
>    at System.Xml.XmlConvert.VerifyNCName(String name, ExceptionType exceptionType)
>    at System.Xml.Linq.XName..ctor(XNamespace ns, String localName)
>    at System.Xml.Linq.XNamespace.GetName(String localName, Int32 index, Int32 count)
>    at NuGet.Configuration.CredentialsItem.AsXNode()
>    at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectListIterator`2.MoveNext()
>    at System.Xml.Linq.XContainer.AddContentSkipNotify(Object content)
>    at NuGet.Configuration.SettingsGroup`1.AsXNode()
>    at NuGet.Configuration.SettingsGroup`1.Add(T setting)
>    at NuGet.Configuration.NuGetConfiguration.AddOrUpdate(String sectionName, SettingItem item)
>    at NuGet.Configuration.Settings.AddOrUpdate(SettingsFile settingsFile, String sectionName, SettingItem item)
>    at NuGet.Configuration.Settings.AddOrUpdate(String sectionName, SettingItem item)
>    at NuGet.Configuration.PackageSourceProvider.AddPackageSource(PackageSource source, Boolean shouldSkipSave, Boolean& isDirty)
>    at NuGet.Configuration.PackageSourceProvider.AddPackageSource(PackageSource source)
>    at NuGet.CommandLine.SourcesCommand.AddNewSource()
>    at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.ExecuteCommandAsync()
>    at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.Execute()
>    at NuGet.CommandLine.Program.MainCore(String workingDirectory, String[] args)
> 
>

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Make PluginManager constructor public again" (#8379) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In 0690359#diff-f2833de1ecaed93179251b95dde8d2a5R56 (related to NuGet/Home#8057), the constructor for PluginManager was made internal for seemingly no reason.

This would allow us to track the improvements made in https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8039 & 
https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8339 &
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/2935

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""Unknown command" is a worthless error message" (#8377) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
```
> nuget.exe --version
Unknown command: '--version'

> nuget.exe --help
Unknown command: '--help'

> nuget.exe -help
Unknown command: '-help'
```

This is worthless.  Either display the help or tell me how to display the help.  Don't make me guess.

4th times a charm.

```
> nuget.exe help
NuGet Version: 4.1.0.2450
usage: NuGet <command> [args] [options]
Type 'NuGet help <command>' for help on a specific command.

Available commands:

 add         Adds the given package to a hierarchical source. http sources are not supported. For more info, goto https
             ://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#add-command.

 config      Gets or sets NuGet config values.

 delete      Deletes a package from the server.

 help (?)    Displays general help information and help information about other commands.

 init        Adds all the packages from the <srcPackageSourcePath> to the hierarchical <destPackageSourcePath>. http fe
             eds are not supported. For more info, goto https://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#init-comm
             and.

 install     Installs a package using the specified sources. If no sources are specified, all sources defined in the Nu
             Get configuration file are used. If the configuration file specifies no sources, uses the default NuGet fe
             ed.

 list        Displays a list of packages from a given source. If no sources are specified, all sources defined in %AppD
             ata%\NuGet\NuGet.config are used. If NuGet.config specifies no sources, uses the default NuGet feed.

 locals      Clears or lists local NuGet resources such as http requests cache, temp cache or machine-wide global packa
             ges folder.

 pack        Creates a NuGet package based on the specified nuspec or project file.

 push        Pushes a package to the server and publishes it.
             NuGet's default configuration is obtained by loading %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config, then loading any nuget.
             config or .nuget\nuget.config starting from root of drive and ending in current directory.

 restore     Restores NuGet packages.

 setApiKey   Saves an API key for a given server URL. When no URL is provided API key is saved for the NuGet gallery.

 sources     Provides the ability to manage list of sources located in %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config

 spec        Generates a nuspec for a new package. If this command is run in the same folder as a project file (.csproj
             , .vbproj, .fsproj), it will create a tokenized nuspec file.

 update      Update packages to latest available versions. This command also updates NuGet.exe itself.

For more information, visit http://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference
```
